page.title: 15ROADS THROUGH S.ELKINGTON
page.content: The intended route for the urgent Louth by_pass,over farm land at the east of the S.Elkington area, is being surveyed at present There are two main roads,the A147 from Lincoln and the A631 from Gainsborough and the Midlands. They carry coastal traffic in summer,and lorries daily, some transporting goods produced in Louth. The A631 is a route for airmen working at RAF Binbrook.One minor road links S.Elkington with Welton-le-Wold village.Other roads are tarmaced farm tracks,some gated and with cattle grids. An old carriage way from the Lincoln road to Elkington Hall has almost disappeared,but one whale-bone jaw marks where the gates were hung.
